user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I like this product when I'm in a rush and want an all in one flush on my cheeks. The only downfall is it's very pigmented. VERY. You have to go easy with it if you have a lighter skin tone. Overall it looks beautiful when I apply it lightly. Would recommend for tan to deep skin tones.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I like the product, beautiful colors that go onto the face nicely. But the first mosaic I purchased broke into pieces. Sephora allowed me to exchange the broken one for a new one. The second one also broke. This product just separates/breaks too easily.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I like this blush but wouldn’t pay full price for it. I redeemed a Sephora $100 gift card for this and honestly if I had spent money would have returned it. It is a basic matte blush. The top champagne shade has the slightest bit of sheen but I don’t really see it on my cheeks. It is very long lasting which I like most about it. My foundation had faded after 10 hours of wear without primer or setting spray but my blush was still going strong. It’s too hard/inconvenient to put an eyeshadow brush in to try and use the shades individually. Overall it’s nice, it wears well, but the formula or summery coral shade isn’t anything special. I feel like Milani or Colourpop could do the exact same thing for way less $.
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: So far, so good. It looks bizarre but when you put it on the colors work well together.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
This is the first Nars product I’ve ever purchased. It is STUNNING! The blush shade is so beautiful and I think it would work well with many different skintones. I’m med/tan, and it looked like a nice “natural” rosy glow. Even though it’s a powder product, I’ve been using it with a stippling brush, and I really like how it distributes the colors on my cheeks. Since I bought it, it’s pretty much the only cheek product I’ve been using. Definitely follow the instructions and use it with a flat brush to ensure an even distribution of the highlight, blush, and bronzer.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Gray', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: Gorgeous color combination and lightweight finish. Colors can be applied individually or mixed. Works as blush, eyeshadow, and highlighter. Does not streak or clump on my very oily skin.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Way too bright for my skin tone, even using a very light hand/fluffy brush to apply. I generally like a bold blush color, but this just looked clownish on me. This might have been because it was both bold and more pink than I usually go for. (for reference—I’m generally the “light” (not ultra “fair”) in concealer/powder, and have yellow undertones.) Gave it 3* as I think it would probably be really pretty on other skin tones, and love the NARS blush packaging + generous size.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This trio is such fun. I was worried it would be “too much” on my pale, porcelain complexion, but it’s another truly universal shade. There’s a hint on shimmer in the highlighter, but the bronzer and blush are both matte. With the right brush, you can actually use all of them separately, especially the highlight, but they really are better together. I will shed a tear when I hit the pan of this limited edition.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: a piece of art literally.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love this blush color! It's great on it's own or swirled together. I would have loved to better be able to use just the highlighter or bronzer, the layout makes it difficult, but it's still a fantastic color regardless. Great watermelon pop, and not overly shiny.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This blush is so perfect, on my skin it leaves a perfect color of health and it looks like I've sunbathed.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: You need this in your blush collection
review_content:
I really wanted a new blush in my collection, but I started to feel like every one I swatched was starting to look like something I already had. When I swatched this, I knew immediately I had to have it! The combination of the colors is so unique and beautiful. This will be the blush color of summer 2019. My go-to look right now is using all colors as blush, the bronzer on my eyelids and nose contour, and the highlighter on my cheekbones and under eyebrows. Get this NOW since its limited time.

review_content: OMG I love this! It's so pretty all swirled together. You will need a super fluffy brush and a light hand because the coral blush is intense. The highlight and bronzer are to skinny to swipe individually don't bother trying.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: This compact is gorgeous! It's my first NARS purchase, as I'd gotten a sample of their Orgasm blush previously. I think the actual blush color may end up being to bright for lighter skin tones. It does give an overall pretty, healthy glow.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I fell in love with NARS blush over two years ago when I discovered "Orgasm". They have gone and made me fall in love again with "Fireclay" It's easiest to use if you just swirl your brush over the 3 colors, but you can just use the blush shade for a matte blush, without much worry of getting one of the other colors mixed in. If you want to use the contour or highlighter by itself, you need to use a smaller brush than you're probably used to using to avoid getting the blush color mixed in. This color looks amazing on both very fair and very dark skintones. The color is very buildable; you can go from very subtle to as much drama as you like, so fair skinned gals shouldn't worry the color is too bright.

review_content: Beautiful. Worth every penny. For all of if not most skin types.

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This gives the perfect summer glow and leaves such a healthy looking skin coloring. I am so happy I found this at sephora on Saturday and had to buy it after trying it on. you can use each separately or take the brush over all the colors for that perfect glow of color!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This blush looks so beautiful in the palette, and when swirled together is the prettiest coral. Glowing but not shimmery. It stayed on all day, was really impressed at the staying power.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This product is so beautiful on my dark/deep skin tone. It gives a nice subtle flush and glow at the same time. I swirl my brush in all the shades and apply!! Absolutely gorgeous and natural looking.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: Using all three shades swirled together is when this palette really jumps to life! It gives the most beautiful coral flush with a golden sheen, but it’s not overly frosty or metallic. Lasting power is great, it doesn’t apply patchy or dry, and it doesn’t accentuate textural issues. It’s an absolute stunner!

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This is a beautiful blush, it is meant to be swirled all together!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I swirl my brush mixing all of the colors and wow! This gives such a beautiful radiant, summer glow! The color reminds me of a light wash of watermelon shade. Very stunning on tan skin. I don't have any other shade like this in my collection.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I bought this product with the intention of swirling all the colours together because the bronzer and highlighter are too skinny to be used individually. I use a dense brush and lightly tap into the product. It creates this beautiful, luminous coral hue! The highlighter give the blush a natural golden sheen (with no detectable glitter or shimmer particles). When I wore this blush, everyone kept commenting on how healthy my skin looks, probably because it gives the “I just did a yoga class” type of glow to your cheeks. It lasted through my 16-hour work shift too!
